title: 112_s3350
content: The Act may be cited as the "End Debt Collector Abuse Act of 2012" and includes provisions for enhanced validation notices. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act is amended to include new requirements for debt collectors, such as providing the date of the last payment, the amount of the debt at that time, the name and address of the last creditor, an itemization of the debt, and informing consumers of their right to request a cease in communication. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act is amended to include new requirements for debt collectors, such as providing consumer communication details, stopping collection efforts upon request, and disclosing complaint handling contact information. This section and its amendments will take effect one year after the Act's enactment. SEC. 3. MEDICAL DEBT PROVISIONS. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act is amended to address medical debt, highlighting its unique nature and the negative impact of aggressive collection practices on consumers' access to healthcare. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act is amended to prohibit medical facility contacts for debt collection in critical care departments. Additionally, unfair medical debt collection practices are outlined to protect consumers' access to healthcare. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act is amended to prohibit withholding emergency medical services or using protected health information for debt collection purposes. SEC. 820. TREATMENT OF MEDICAL DEBT. Sections 806, 807, 808, 811, and 813 apply to the collection of medical debt, whether by the creditor or a third party. Collectors must disclose available financial assistance and provide information on how to apply for it. The section requires collectors to disclose the availability of charity care coverage, financial assistance, discounts, or insurance that may help with medical debt payment. It also mandates providing information on how to apply for such programs. SEC. 4. DISPUTE INVESTIGATIONS AND VERIFICATION. Amends the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act to require debt collectors to conduct a thorough investigation and provide specific information and verification when a debt is disputed by the consumer. SEC. 5. AWARD OF DAMAGES. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act is amended to include an adjustment for inflation in additional damages indexed to the Consumer Price Index. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act is amended to include annual adjustments for inflation indexed to the Consumer Price Index. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act is amended to include annual adjustments for inflation indexed to the Consumer Price Index. Increases made under section 813(f) shall apply to violations occurring after the enactment date. Injunctive relief may be awarded in civil actions for violations of the Act. SEC. 6. WARRANT FOR ARREST AS UNFAIR DEBT COLLECTION PRACTICE. Amends the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act to prohibit debt collectors from requesting arrest warrants for debtors, clarifying that courts can still hold debtors in civil contempt or allow debt collectors to seek other remedies for debt collection.
